data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
Backus actually considered FP a serious programming language (or at
    least a serious improvement over FORTRAN). Using a combinator
    language (like FP) exposes the programmer to a paradigm not seen
    today outside of shell command pipelines. It's an interesting
    excercise, sort of the antithesis of Object-Orientedness.
